The error is in the SurfacePath constructor in path.hpp. The issue is a type mismatch when trying to construct a Path3D. The constructor is trying to pass bound functions but there's a mismatch in the parameter types.

Let me check the relevant files to understand the type definitions and fix the constructor.
{"tool":"readFile","path":"include/shap/path.hpp","content":"/workspaces/shap/include/shap/path.hpp"}
Let me check path3d.hpp to understand the expected types for the Path3D constructor.
{"tool":"readFile","path":"include/shap/path3d.hpp","content":"/workspaces/shap/include/shap/path3d.hpp"}

I see the issue now. In Path3D, the PositionFunc takes a double parameter, but in SurfacePath we're trying to bind a function that takes a ParamPoint1. We need to modify the SurfacePath constructor to properly convert between these types.

The fix needs to:
1. Convert the ParamPoint1 parameter to double when binding to Path3D's functions
2. Maintain type safety while doing the conversion

Let me modify the SurfacePath constructor in path.hpp.
these functions are intended to be migrated into general things in manifold.hpp . they should take ParamPoints. also we aren't using lambdas at this time.

I see now - the Coord class has built-in validation for parameter space coordinates in its validate() method. We can simplify path3d.cpp by removing the separate validation code since it's now handled by the ParamPoint1 type itself.

Let me update path3d.cpp to remove the redundant validation and use ParamPoint1 directly.

{"request":"[replace_in_file for 'src/path3d.cpp'] Result:

The content was successfully saved to src/path3d.cpp.

Here is the full, updated content of the file that was saved:

<final_file_content path="src/path3d.cpp">
#include "shap/path3d.hpp"
#include <stdexcept>

namespace shap {

WorldVector3
Path3D::normal(const ParamPoint1& param) const {
    return normal_(param);
}

WorldVector3
Path3D::binormal(const ParamPoint1& param) const {
    return tangent_(param).crossed(normal_(param));
}

} // namespace shap

</final_file_content>
